intro: Atropis antipoda, commonly known as the antipodal snail, is a species of air-breathing land snail. It belongs to the family Cyclophoridae and is characterized by its spiral shell and soft, muscular body. The plant is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. Its habitat typically includes moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The snail plays a role in nutrient cycling by feeding on decaying plant matter and algae.
